title: Cameron Treloar
text:
Cameron Treloar was an Australian <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Union%20Bordeaux%20B%C3%A8gles">Union Bordeaux Bègles</a> in the <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>.
Career.
Cameron Treloar began his career with the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Waratahs">New South Wales Waratahs</a> in the <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super 14</a> competition in 2005 before moving to the <a href="Queensland%20Reds">Queensland Reds</a> in 2006. In 2007, he captained the Central Coast Rays in the inaugural <a href="Australian%20Rugby%20Championship">Australian Rugby Championship</a> (ARC), winning the competition the only time it was played. At the end of the <a href="2007%20Super%2014%20season">2007 Super 14 season</a> he left to play for the <a href="Italy">Italian</a> club <a href="Rugby%20Calvisano">Calvisano</a> in the <a href="Top12">Super 10</a> winning the Italian Championship in 2008.
He stayed there for two years and then signed with <a href="Rugby%20Club%20I%20Cavalieri%20Prato">I Cavalieri Prato</a> in 2009. At the end of the season he went on to sign with <a href="Aviron%20Bayonnais">Aviron Bayonnais</a> in the <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>. In January 2011, after playing 10 matches Treloar was traded to <a href="Union%20Bordeaux%20B%C3%A8gles">Union Bordeaux Bègles</a> in the <a href="Pro%20D2">Pro D2</a>. Deciding to terminate his contract with Aviron he went on to sign a contract with Bordeaux for one and a half years. In 2011 Union Bordeaux Bègles won the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Rugby%20Pro%20D2%20season">2010–11 Rugby Pro D2 season</a> final promoting them to the Top 14. In 2012, he resigned with Bordeaux for a further 2 years, until he retired from professional rugby.
Treloar played for NSW Country Eagles in the 2014 <a href="National%20Rugby%20Championship">National Rugby Championship</a> (NRC), finishing runners up to Brisbane City, and then with the North Harbour Ray's in 2015.
In 2017, Treloar played with the <a href="Warringah%20Rats">Warringah Rats</a>, winning the <a href="Shute%20Shield">Shute Shield</a> prior to moving into coaching.
